posts.post_content: @Guest1661376406 : Since you don't actually cast the spell again, you don't need to pay any costs, mana or otherwise. If you copy a kicked spell, you'll get a kicked copy. If you copy an X spell, you get the same value of X on your copy.

Posted By: Luke_BPC (10/2/2010 9:32:33 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Darth Parallax: First of all, i agree with you in why the artifact should be mythic, but you do have some details wrong. First of all the Mirari was attached to the hilt of Kamahl's sword, it didn't transform into one. Secondly, the Mirari has nothing to do with the legacy, unless you count being made by Karn as part of it, which i certainly don't. The Mirari was a defective probe sent to Dominaria to gather inspiration for the creation and population of Argentum, later known as Mirrodin.   
  
Aside from minor details most people couldn't care more about, you are right in that this artifact has been part of three blocks, and is about as mythic as they come. Personally, I wish it was a bit stronger, but at least it is functional and flavorful, as it amplifies spells just like it did in the books.
posts.html:
@Darth Parallax: First of all, i agree with you in why the artifact should be mythic, but you do have some details wrong. First of all the Mirari was attached to the hilt of Kamahl's sword, it didn't transform into one. Secondly, the Mirari has nothing to do with the legacy, unless you count being made by Karn as part of it, which i certainly don't. The Mirari was a defective probe sent to Dominaria to gather inspiration for the creation and population of Argentum, later known as Mirrodin.

Aside from minor details most people couldn't care more about, you are right in that this artifact has been part of three blocks, and is about as mythic as they come. Personally, I wish it was a bit stronger, but at least it is functional and flavorful, as it amplifies spells just like it did in the books.

Posted By: Elvoran (10/27/2011 12:48:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@CruentusPurgare  
  
No. The ability is a triggered one, which allows you to pay 3 to copy a spell when it is cast. When a spell is copied it is not cast again, so the Mirari's ability will not trigger again.
posts.html:
@CruentusPurgare

No. The ability is a triggered one, which allows you to pay 3 to copy a spell when it is cast. When a spell is copied it is not cast again, so the Mirari's ability will not trigger again.

posts.post_content: @darthparallax actually the mirari was placed inside the sword of [Kamahl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl) after [Chainer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chainer) used it and died. The sword itself was forged by [Balthor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balthor) the dwarf. It was described by Sethon and Krosa as reflecting the person's innermost desires. But as to Jeska/Phage fusion, they were the same person. Jeska was captured injured by Braids and corrupted by the Cabal Patriarch. You were referring I believe to just Phage.
posts.html:
@darthparallax actually the mirari was placed inside the sword of Kamahl after Chainer used it and died. The sword itself was forged by Balthor the dwarf.
